cards.name: Bellsprout
cards.text: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Weepinbell
cards.text: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Victreebel

abilities.name: Wafting Scent
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.text: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Heracross-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Giga Power
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself. | When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

cards.name: M Heracross-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Big Bang Horn
attacks.text: This attack does 180 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Shroomish
cards.text: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.

cards.name: Leafeon
cards.text: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you'll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage and heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Shelmet
cards.text: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Accelgor
cards.text: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Shelmet during this turn, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Afterimage Strike
attacks.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Magmar
cards.text: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather's body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Magmortar
cards.text: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Twin Bursts
attacks.text: If Electivire is on your Bench, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Torchic
cards.text: It has a flame sac inside its belly that perpetually burns. It feels warm if it is hugged.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Combusken
cards.text: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.

attacks.name: Midair Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Blaziken
cards.text: It can clear a 30-story building in a leap. Its fiery punches scorch its foes.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Burning Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 150 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Poliwag
cards.text: Its slick black skin is thin and damp. A part of its internal organs can be seen through the skin as a spiral pattern.

attacks.name: Spiral Current
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. That Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Poliwhirl
cards.text: It can live in or out of water. When out of water, it constantly sweats to keep its body slimy.

attacks.name: Finishing Blow
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Poliwrath
cards.text: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.

attacks.name: Steamroll
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Politoed

abilities.name: King's Song
abilities.text: Ignore all Colorless Energy in the attack cost of each of your Poliwag, Poliwhirl, and Poliwrath's attacks.

cards.text: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.

cards.name: Glaceon
cards.text: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Ice Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Seismitoad-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Quaking Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Grenade Hammer
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Cubchoo
cards.text: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Beartic
cards.text: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.

attacks.name: Igloo Hold
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Mountain Drop
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Clauncher
cards.text: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Clawitzer
cards.text: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.

attacks.name: Reverse Thrust
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splash Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Amaura
cards.text: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.

cards.name: Aurorus

abilities.name: Ice Shield
abilities.text: Any damage done by an opponent's attack to each of your Water Pokémon that has any Water Energy attached to it is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Raichu
cards.text: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.text: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its body glows a whitish blue.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Electivire
cards.text: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.

attacks.name: Tag Team Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your Magmortar.

attacks.name: Gigavolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Plusle
cards.text: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

attacks.name: Positive Hand
attacks.text: Discard a basic Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Electric Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Minun
cards.text: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.

attacks.name: Negative Discard
attacks.text: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Thundurus
cards.text: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder Punch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Lightning Slam
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Lightning Slam during your next turn.

cards.name: Dedenne
cards.text: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.

attacks.name: Entrainment
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Energy Short
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Drowzee
cards.text: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.

attacks.name: Sinister Suggestion
attacks.text: Whenever your opponent flips a coin during his or her next turn, treat it as tails.

cards.name: Hypno
cards.text: It carries a pendulum-like device. There once was an incident in which it took away a child it hypnotized.

attacks.name: Hand Control
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. You may choose a Supporter card you find there. If you do, your opponent plays that Supporter card. However, you make all decisions for that card. (That Supporter card is discarded.)

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Jynx

abilities.name: Victory Kiss
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may heal 10 damage from your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: It wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Skorupi
cards.text: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Gothita
cards.text: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Gothorita
cards.text: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

attacks.name: Fortunate Eye
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck and put them back on top of his or her deck in any order.

cards.name: Gothitelle

abilities.name: Teleport Room
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, put a Stadium card with a different name from your discard pile into play.

cards.text: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

attacks.name: Psy Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

cards.name: Golett
cards.text: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Golurk
cards.text: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 60 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

cards.name: Machop
cards.text: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.

cards.name: Machoke
cards.text: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

cards.name: Machamp

abilities.name: Fighting Fury
abilities.text: Each of your Fighting Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.

attacks.name: Machamp Crush
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 40 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Hitmonlee
cards.text: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Hitmonchan
cards.text: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Hitmontop
cards.text: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by 10.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Helicoptero
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Breloom
cards.text: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Makuhita
cards.text: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.

cards.name: Hariyama

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire or Water Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.

cards.name: Trapinch
cards.text: It lives in arid deserts. It makes a sloping pit trap in sand where it patiently awaits prey.

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Lucario-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Missile Jab
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Corkscrew Smash
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

cards.name: M Lucario-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: M Lucario-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rising Fist
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Mienfoo
cards.text: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Mienshao
cards.text: It wields the fur on its arm like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.

attacks.name: Aero Turn
attacks.text: Return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Landorus
cards.text: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as "The Guardian of the Fields."

attacks.name: Shout of Power
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Pancham
cards.text: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.

attacks.name: Bad-Influence Evolution
attacks.text: If you have any Darkness Pokémon on your Bench, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Pancham
cards.text: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Tyrunt
cards.text: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn't like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Tyrantrum
cards.text: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.

attacks.name: Chew Up
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Hawlucha

abilities.name: Shining Spirit
abilities.text: Damage from this Pokémon's attacks isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.text: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.

attacks.name: Flying Press
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon isn't a Pokémon-EX, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Hawlucha-EX

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Moonsault Stomp
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Drapion
cards.text: It takes great pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Scraggy
cards.text: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling it skin up to its neck.

cards.name: Scrafty
cards.text: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.

attacks.name: Machine Gun Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Pangoro
cards.text: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won't put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.

attacks.name: Clobber
attacks.text: You may discard an Item card from your hand. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Hammer Arm
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

attacks.name: Moonlight
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

attacks.name: Moonblast
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Clefable
cards.text: Its hearing is so acute it can hear a pin drop over half a mile away. It lives on quiet mountains.

attacks.name: Follow Me
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Moonblast
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Sylveon
cards.text: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.

attacks.name: Curly Ribbon
attacks.text: Move an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Klefki

abilities.name: Secret Key
abilities.text: Each of your Fairy Pokémon's Resistance is now -40.

cards.text: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.

attacks.name: Fairy Lock
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Dragonite-EX

abilities.name: Bust In
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may move any number of basic Energy attached to your Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Sonic
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Vibrava
cards.text: The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its two wings together cause severe headaches.

attacks.name: Charge Energy
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Flygon
cards.text: It hides itself by kicking up desert sand with its wings. Red covers shield its eyes from sand.

attacks.name: Rainbow Shower
attacks.text: Attach as many basic Energy cards as you like from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Sand Sweep
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

cards.name: Noivern

abilities.name: Echolocation
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

cards.text: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.

attacks.name: Boomburst
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Lickitung
cards.text: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Lickilicky
cards.text: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Lickichop
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Eevee

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: A rare Pokémon that adapts to harsh environments by taking on different evolutionary forms.

cards.name: Slakoth
cards.text: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.

attacks.name: Big Yawn
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Asleep.

cards.name: Vigoroth
cards.text: Its heartbeat is fast and its blood so agitated that it can't sit still for one second.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Slaking
cards.text: The world's laziest Pokémon. It moves to another spot when there's no food left within its reach.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Knuckle Sandwich
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Patrat
cards.text: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

attacks.name: Safety Check
attacks.text: Look at 1 of your face-down Prize cards.

cards.name: Watchog
cards.text: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

attacks.name: Held-Item Inspection
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose an Item card you find there. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Thorough Crunch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Tornadus
cards.text: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Twister Throw
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Noibat
cards.text: They live in pitch black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

cards.name: Battle Reporter
cards.text: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Switch
cards.text: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Fighting Stadium
cards.text: The attacks of each Fighting Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) do 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon-EX (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Focus Sash
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If the Fighting Pokémon this card is attached to has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, that Pokémon is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead. Then, discard this card.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Fossil Researcher
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Amaura or Tyrunt and put them onto your bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Full Heal
cards.text: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Jaw Fossil
cards.text: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Tyrunt you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Korrina
cards.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Pokémon and an Item card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Maintenance
cards.text: Shuffle 2 cards from your hand into your deck. (If you can't shuffle 2 cards into your deck, you can't play this card.) Then, draw a card.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Mountain Ring
cards.text: Prevent all damage done to Benched Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Sail Fossil
cards.text: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Amaura you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Sparkling Robe
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Pokémon this card is attached to can't be affected by any Special Conditions. (Remove any Special Conditions affecting that Pokémon.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Super Scoop Up
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Tool Retriever
cards.text: Choose up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to your Pokémon and put them into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Training Center
cards.text: Each Stage 1 and Stage 2 Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets +30 HP.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Herbal Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to Grass Pokémon. This card provides Grass Energy only while this card is attached to a Grass Pokémon.,When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Grass Pokémon, heal 30 damage from that Pokémon.,(If this card is attached to anything other than a Grass Pokémon, discard this card.)

cards.name: Strong Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to Fighting Pokémon. This card provides Fighting Energy only while this card is attached to a Fighting Pokémon.,The attacks of the Fighting Pokémon this card is attached to do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,(If this card is attached to anything other than a Fighting Pokémon, discard this card.)

cards.name: Heracross-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Giga Power
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Seismitoad-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Quaking Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Grenade Hammer
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Lucario-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Missile Jab
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Corkscrew Smash
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Dragonite-EX

abilities.name: Bust In
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may move any number of basic Energy attached to your Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Sonic
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Battle Reporter
cards.text: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Fossil Researcher
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Amaura or Tyrunt and put them onto your bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Korrina
cards.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Pokémon and an Item card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: M Heracross-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Big Bang Horn
attacks.text: This attack does 180 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: M Lucario-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rising Fist
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
